H0.text: Volcanic island arcs are the features that most likely form when crustal plates pull apart from one another.

H2.text: Oceanic trenches are formed by crustal plates that pull apart from one another.

H3.text: Rift zones are formed by crustal plates that pull apart from one another.

A4.text: Divergent boundaries within continents initially produce rifts, which eventually become rift valleys.

A5.text: Divergent boundaries can create massive fault zones in the oceanic ridge system.
